name: clinical_services_proposal
description: Staffing and clinical coverage proposal for hospital partnerships

metadata.author: Project Wizard Team
metadata.use_case: Physician/APP staffing agreements, clinical service coverage models

inputs.label: Current Challenges (What problems does the hospital face?)
inputs.description: E.g., 'variable ICU coverage, locum dependency (35% of shifts), delayed consult response (45+ min average), difficulty recruiting board-certified specialists'

inputs.label: Clinical Impact of These Challenges
inputs.description: How do these challenges affect patient care? E.g., 'Inconsistent ventilator protocols, higher handoff errors (23% documented), 0.7-day longer average LOS'

inputs.label: Operational Impact
inputs.description: Staffing and workflow issues. E.g., 'Uneven staffing burdens on hospitalists, frequent call coverage gaps, nursing coordination challenges'

inputs.label: Financial Impact
inputs.description: Cost pressures. E.g., 'Locum costs averaging $2.5M/year, unplanned overtime at premium rates, budget volatility'

inputs.label: Scope of Services
inputs.description: Bullet list of services included (admissions, consultations, procedures, rounding, code participation, etc.)

inputs.label: Procedures Included
inputs.description: E.g., 'Bronchoscopy, thoracentesis, central line placement, mechanical ventilation oversight, rapid response participation'

inputs.label: Staffing Model (Roles & Schedule)
inputs.description: Describe in detail. E.g., '1 Physician (24/7 rotation: days/nights), 1 APP (weekday rounds 0700-1700, night call backup), built-in redundancy for absences'

inputs.label: Current Baseline Metrics (Measured Data)
inputs.description: Current state with specific numbers. E.g., 'ICU LOS: 4.2 days, Mortality Index: 1.15, Consult turnaround: 45 min, Readmission rate: 18%, Daily patient census: 28'

inputs.label: Target/Goal Metrics (What You Aim to Achieve)
inputs.description: Desired state. E.g., 'ICU LOS: 3.8 days (10% reduction), Mortality Index: 0.95, Consult turnaround: <30 min, Readmission: <15%, Maintain census stability'

inputs.label: Financial Terms & Pricing
inputs.description: Detailed pricing structure. E.g., 'Base monthly stipend: $X for 24/7 coverage, includes APP support and admin time, optional clinic coverage at $Y/half-day, annual adjustments per CPI'

inputs.label: Contract Term & Duration
inputs.description: E.g., 'One (1) year with annual renewal', '3-year initial term with 1-year renewals', etc.

inputs.label: Compliance & Insurance Requirements
inputs.description: E.g., 'Malpractice insurance $1M/$3M, active hospital privileges, HIPAA/OSHA compliance, DEA licensure, state medical licensure'

inputs.label: Governance & Communication Plan
inputs.description: E.g., 'Weekly coordination calls with nursing leadership, monthly QI meetings, quarterly board reporting, rapid escalation for critical issues'

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.description: High-level overview: partnership purpose, key highlights, value proposition

sections.title: Background and Need
sections.description: Current challenges and their clinical, operational, and financial impacts

sections.title: Proposed Coverage Model
sections.description: Detailed scope of services, staffing model, procedures, EMR integration, operational workflows

sections.title: Quality and Performance Metrics
sections.description: Baseline vs. target metrics in table format; review frequency

sections.title: Financial Proposal
sections.description: Pricing table with categories, rates, and notes; key assumptions

sections.title: Governance and Communication
sections.description: Leadership coordination, reporting cadence, quality meetings, improvement cycles

sections.title: Compliance and Risk Management
sections.description: Insurance, licensure, credentialing, HIPAA/OSHA, hospital bylaws adherence

sections.title: Conclusion and Next Steps
sections.description: Partnership value proposition, next steps (review, alignment, contract drafting, credentialing)

verification_questions.question: Are baseline and target metrics specific numbers from measured data (not estimated or vague)?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Use actual measured metrics (e.g., '4.2 days' not 'lengthy LOS'). If data unavailable, note as 'to be established baseline'.

verification_questions.question: Does the Coverage Model clearly specify staffing numbers, schedule (24/7 vs. defined), and included procedures?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Add specific counts (e.g., '1 Physician, 1 APP'), schedules (e.g., '24/7 rotation: days 0700-1900, nights 1900-0700'), and procedures list.

verification_questions.question: Does the proposal clearly link how your staffing model addresses the hospital's specific challenges?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: For each challenge listed, explain how your proposed model mitigates it (e.g., 'Challenge: 35% locum dependency → Solution: 100% dedicated staffing eliminates external dependencies').

verification_questions.question: Are all team member names, credentials, and experience claims verifiable in the provided inputs (no hallucinated people)?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Use generic language ('board-certified intensivists', 'experienced APPs') unless specific names and credentials are provided. Never invent Dr. names or false credentials.

verification_questions.question: Are all financial claims (cost savings, ROI, fee justification) grounded in provided data or reasonable assumptions?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Use only stated metrics or clearly document assumptions (e.g., 'Assuming $5K per locum shift and 35% coverage = estimated $2.5M annual locum spend').

verification_questions.question: Does the proposal fit within 5–7 pages without repetition across sections?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Ensure each section has a unique purpose: Background (problems), Model (solution), Metrics (measurement), Financial (cost), Governance (oversight). Do not repeat metrics in multiple sections.

criteria.name: Clinical Specificity
criteria.description: Baseline/target metrics are data-grounded; clinical impacts are concrete

excellent.description: All metrics backed by data; clear clinical rationale for targets

good.description: Most metrics specific; minor vagueness in clinical impact

adequate.description: Some metrics specific; some assumptions noted

needs_improvement.description: Many vague metrics; weak clinical grounding

poor.description: No specific metrics; generic clinical language

criteria.name: Staffing Model Clarity
criteria.description: Clear on roles, schedule, procedures, and operationally feasible

excellent.description: Specific staffing numbers, schedule details, procedures; clearly integrated with hospital workflows

good.description: Staffing well-defined; minor gaps in schedule or integration detail

adequate.description: Staffing outlined; some operational details missing

needs_improvement.description: Vague staffing description; limited operational detail

poor.description: Unclear staffing model; no operational integration plan

criteria.name: Value Alignment
criteria.description: Proposal clearly addresses hospital's challenges and demonstrates ROI

excellent.description: Each challenge mapped to specific solution; financial and clinical ROI clear

good.description: Good alignment; some ROI details missing

adequate.description: Challenges addressed; ROI implied but not explicit

poor.description: No clear connection between challenges and proposed solution

criteria.name: Professionalism & Completeness
criteria.description: Professional tone, well-organized, all sections present with no hallucinations

excellent.description: Polished, well-structured, all sections strong, zero hallucinations

good.description: Professional; complete; minor formatting or tone issues

needs_improvement.description: Several sections weak; tone issues; possible minor hallucinations
